summary: This document is a series of email exchanges primarily from May 2021 between attorneys, including Brendan Quigley, regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling calls, a proffer agreement from February 2020, and a request from another attorney seeking to contact or serve an individual referred to as 'Mr. S.' or 'Mr. Rogers' in connection with an active civil case.

persons.name: Brendan F. Quigley
persons.role: Attorney, Partner at Baker Botts L.L.P.
persons.context: Primary correspondent in the emails, discussing the SDNY investigation, scheduling calls, and handling inquiries from other attorneys regarding an individual connected to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Mr. S.
persons.role: Individual with an active civil case in connection with Epstein
persons.context: Referred to in an email from June 2020; another attorney is seeking to serve him a request or subpoena for documents and/or testimony.

persons.name: Mr. Rogers
persons.role: Individual, likely the same as 'Mr. S.'
persons.context: Mentioned as an individual whom an attorney might attempt to contact or serve directly, suggesting he is a person of interest in the civil case.

connections.description: The emails suggest Brendan Quigley is or was in contact with Mr. S. in connection with the SDNY investigation, and is being asked about serving him legal documents.

events.title: Proffer Agreement Signed
events.description: A proffer agreement was signed, as mentioned in an email attachment from February 7, 2020.

events.title: Attorney Inquiry Regarding Civil Case
events.description: An attorney for an individual with an active civil case connected to Epstein reached out to inquire about contacting or serving 'Mr. S.'

keyFacts: The emails discuss the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, indicating ongoing legal activity related to the case in 2020-2021.
An attorney sought to contact or serve 'Mr. S.' (also referred to as 'Mr. Rogers') for documents/testimony in an active civil case connected to Epstein.
A proffer agreement was signed on February 7, 2020, suggesting cooperation negotiations were part of the investigation.
Brendan F. Quigley, a partner at Baker Botts L.L.P., appears to be a point of contact for matters related to 'Mr. S.' and the SDNY investigation.
